result.execSummary:
The defendant James David Cross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 09/25/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Court found the Domesti Abuse surcharge is applicable. Court waived the DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was taken. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment as able.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James David Cross

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James David Cross in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant James David Cross in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Court waived the DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was taken.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment as able.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James David Cross in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Vega informs court that he will be retiering. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel to Branch 40.

Defendant James David Cross in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in Court for sentencing however the victim was not available for today's proceedings.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James David Cross in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Br. 4 for Br 40.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 40 on 4-30-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Brenda S., no possession of guns and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant James David Cross in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/06/15 in Branch 40.  State turned over the 911 CD to the defense.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
Court ordered the children removed from the no contact order and will allow 3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.

Defendant James David Cross in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Brenda S., B.H ( 8/27/05), S.C (1/31/11), A.M ( 7/27/09), R.M ( 12/22/11).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James David Cross in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant James David Cross in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for James David Cross
Current: 327 E Deer Place, Milwaukee, WI 53207   (Effective: 01-13-2015)
Prior: 1505 South 10th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
